ref: 852a *avaśuṣka -- ʻ dried up ʼ. [Cf. avaśuṣyati ʻ becomes dry ʼ VāyuP., Pa. avasussati ʻ withers ʼ: √śuṣ1]
Pk. ōsukka -- ʻ dried ʼ, ōsukkhaï ʻ makes dry ʼ;
Kho. (Lor.) osukik, us˚ ʻ to wither, cease suckling (a child), come to an end ʼ with dissimilation of ś to s before ṣ rather than direct < pre --
IA. *suṣ -- ? If u -- is earlier than o -- , prob. < *ut -- śuṣka -- or *upaśuṣka -- .
